TSS South of Gedser — Applicable to vessels navigating in the Baltic Sea near the Danish coast, particularly those transiting between Germany and Sweden or Finland; this area is governed by traffic separation schemes designed to manage high-density shipping along curved, predefined routes.
Operational Protocol Rationale: Cargo vessels operating without hazardous cargo and using engine propulsion in this region typically maintain stable speeds and follow gradual, consistent course changes aligned with designated maritime lanes. The observed behavior—steady speed around 10 knots, minimal heading variation, and a slowly evolving direction—matches standard autopilot-assisted navigation along gently curving channels, where vessels are expected to stay within defined corridors for collision avoidance. This pattern rules out anchoring, erratic maneuvering, or sharp turns, which would suggest operational issues or non-compliance.
